meanings.definition: To give an alternative name or title to (someone or something).
meanings.sent1: She aliased her favorite teddy bear 'Fluffy' as 'Mr. Cuddles'.
meanings.sent2: The author aliased themselves when writing under a pen name.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat aliased the houseplant as its new scratching post.
meanings.sent4: In the spy novel, the protagonist aliased themselves to infiltrate the enemy base.
meanings.sent5: The detective aliased the suspect to gather more information discreetly.

meanings.definition: Having an alternative name or title.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious superhero had an aliased identity to protect their loved ones.
meanings.sent2: The famous singer performed under an aliased stage name.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon stole food under the aliased persona of 'The Snack Bandit'.
meanings.sent4: The masked vigilante fought crime under the aliased guise of 'Night Shadow'.
meanings.sent5: The elusive artist painted masterpieces under an aliased pseudonym.
